intro: Goniogyna hirta, commonly known as the hairy goniogyna, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Goniogyna hirta is often used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
